citation.article-title: Silvimonas terrae gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel chitin-degrading facultative anaerobe belonging to the 'Betaproteobacteria'
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Silvimonas (Sil.vi.mo′nas. L. fem. n. silva forest; L. fem. n. monas a unit, monad; N.L. fem. n. Silvimonas forest monad).
Cells are Gram-negative, rod-shaped (1·3–2·0 μm by 0·5–0·8 μm) and facultatively anaerobic.
They occur singly or in pairs (Fig. 2a) and are motile by means of a single polar flagellum (Fig. 2b).
Colonies on R2A are circular, convex and milky white.
Major cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, summed feature 4 (C16 : 1ω7c/iso-C15 : 0 2-OH), summed feature 7 (C18 : 1ω7c/ω9t/ω12t) and C17 : 0 cyclo.
Based on 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, Silvimonas belongs to the ‘Betaproteobacteria’.
The type species is Silvimonas terrae.
